projects.name: Pop-Up Mechanism

steps.instruction: Fold the tab on the wheel piece in half along the score line and glue it to itself using white glue. Draw two small dots on the ends of tabs A and D (in the little boxes beyond the score lines, as indicated) on the front side of the piece.
steps.visual_description: Image 2 shows a hand folding a tab on a circular piece with numbered slots and applying glue. Image 3 shows the same piece with tabs A and D marked with dots. Image 4 shows the circular piece with numbers 1-6 and letters A-F written on it, placed on a square piece.

steps.instruction: Hold the square piece upside down with the letters oriented so that you can read them and place the wheel (upside down) on top with the numbers oriented so that you can read them, too. Carefully thread tab A (from underneath) through the slot at the top of panel 1. After tab A is in the slot, carefully thread the pull tab through the curved slot at the bottom of the square piece so that it is now on the front side of the mechanism. Make sure the two tabs on either side of the pull tab are not threaded with the pull tab and keep the pull tab in this position as you thread the remaining tabs through the corresponding slots in the wheel.
steps.visual_description: Image 5 shows a close-up of the mechanism being assembled, with tabs being threaded through slots. Image 6 shows a hand holding the mechanism together with a white cap, possibly to secure the pull tab.

steps.instruction: Carefully thread tab B (from underneath) through the slot at the top of panel 2. Continue threading tabs C through F into the slots on panels 3 through 6 in this manner. Once all the tabs are slotted through, you should be able to see all the letters on the tabs (A through F).
steps.visual_description: This step is described in text and illustrated by the continuation of the assembly process shown in images 5 and 6.

steps.instruction: Fold the two tabs marked with the dots toward the front along the score lines.
steps.visual_description: This step is described in text and implied by the assembly process shown in the images.

projects.finished_product_description: A pop-up mechanism with a wheel and tabs that interact to create a pop-up effect.

diagram_descriptions: Image 2: A circular piece with six numbered slots (1-6) and tabs. A hand is shown applying glue to a folded tab.
Image 3: The circular piece from Image 2, with tabs A and D marked with small dots in boxes beyond the score lines.
Image 4: The circular piece with numbers 1-6 and letters A-F visible, placed on a square piece with slots. The square piece has a grid background.
Image 5: A close-up view of the pop-up mechanism being assembled. Tabs are being threaded through slots in the circular and square pieces. The circular piece has a pink patterned design.
Image 6: A hand holding a white cap against the assembled mechanism, possibly to secure a tab or pull tab. The background is a green cutting mat with grid lines.

projects.name: Volvelle (rotating disk)

steps.instruction: Start by gluing the back panel to the folder on one of the folded margins (a glue stick works well for this). Next, put a small dot of white glue on each lettered tab and stick the back panel onto the back of the mechanism, applying pressure (with your hand or a scoring tool) over the areas where you placed the dots of glue in the center. Do not glue the other three folded margins yet.
steps.visual_description: A hand applying white glue to the center of a circular paper mechanism with intricate patterns, which is placed on a white folder. A small pink circular piece is visible on a green cutting mat to the left. This corresponds to the image labeled '7'.

steps.instruction: Turn the whole mechanism over and place a small dot of white glue on top of the dots printed on the two central tabs that you folded over to the front. Attach the central circle element to the tabs and press firmly.

Slide the tab slowly to the right (A through D). The scene on the wheel should start to appear through the six angled slots. If the mechanism does not slide smoothly, check to see whether there are rough edges along any of the cuts that need trimming. All cuts must be very smooth for the mechanism to operate properly. Once it turns smoothly, fold in the remaining three margins along the edges of the folder and adhere them to the inside of the back panel with a glue stick.
steps.visual_description: Four sequential images (8A, 8B, 8C, 8D) show hands testing the mechanism. In 8A, a square, light-colored paper folder with a circular cutout contains a partially rotated circular mechanism with a pink center and two visible patterned segments. A light blue tab on the right is being pulled. In 8B, the tab is pulled further, revealing more patterned segments. In 8C, the tab is pulled almost fully, showing most of the patterned circular mechanism through the six angled slots. In 8D, the tab is pulled to its maximum extent, fully revealing the intricate circular pattern through the six angled slots.

tips: All cuts must be very smooth for the mechanism to operate properly.
projects.finished_product_description: A volvelle (rotating disk) mechanism where a scene on the wheel appears through six angled slots as a tab is slid.

diagram_descriptions: Image labeled '7': A close-up of hands applying white glue to the center of a circular paper mechanism with intricate patterns, which is placed on a white folder. A small pink circular piece is visible on a green cutting mat to the left.

Image labeled '8A': Hands holding a square, light-colored paper folder with a large circular cutout. Inside the cutout is a circular mechanism, partially rotated, showing a pink center and two segments of a patterned design. A light blue tab is visible on the right side, being pulled.
Image labeled '8B': Similar to 8A, the hands are holding the folder, and the blue tab is pulled further to the right, revealing more segments of the patterned circular mechanism.
Image labeled '8C': Similar to 8B, the blue tab is pulled even further, showing almost the entire patterned circular mechanism through the six angled slots.
Image labeled '8D': Similar to 8C, the blue tab is pulled to its maximum extent, fully revealing the intricate circular pattern through the six angled slots of the mechanism.

projects.name: Sleepers, Dreamers & Screamers
projects.finished_product_description: An accordion pop-up book, printed letterpress with hard covers enclosed in a matching clamshell box. The pop-ups are constructed of a variety of papers. The complete text is Weve all had nightmares. Vivid as they may be there is always that sweet release upon waking. But what happens when events in our waking lives surpass even our most horrific dreams. Where is our release now? This book was begun in 2001 and derailed by the events of September 11, 2001. The text was rewritten in the aftermath and finally completed.

templates.name: 3-Dimensional Equilateral Tent Pattern
templates.shape_description: A complex, symmetrical papercraft pattern piece, colored yellow with purple markings. It consists of a central, elongated, hourglass-shaped body with numerous horizontal solid purple lines. This central body is flanked on both sides by two identical, narrower panels (labeled '1'), each featuring multiple diagonal solid purple lines and vertical dotted lines. The top of the pattern is a trapezoidal section (labeled '3') with horizontal solid purple lines. The bottom is another trapezoidal section (labeled '2') also with horizontal solid purple lines, and its lowest edge is a distinctive scalloped cut line. Internal dotted lines indicate score or fold lines, while the overall outer perimeter is a solid cut line.

diagram_descriptions: A full-page diagram of a yellow papercraft pattern piece for a '3-Dimensional Equilateral Tent'. The pattern is symmetrical and features a central section with many horizontal solid purple lines. On either side of the central section are two narrower panels, each labeled '1', containing diagonal solid purple lines and vertical dotted lines. The top section, labeled '3', is trapezoidal and has horizontal solid purple lines. The bottom section, labeled '2', is also trapezoidal with horizontal solid purple lines, and its very bottom edge is a decorative scalloped cut line. Various dotted lines are present throughout the pattern, indicating internal folds or scores, while the outer boundary is a solid black cut line.

diagram_descriptions: A flat, yellow net for a 3-dimensional equilateral pyramid. The net has a scalloped edge at the top and a hatched area on the right side which serves as a glue tab. Dotted lines indicate where to fold. Blue lines are printed diagonally across the faces of the pyramid net. Numbers '1', '2', and '3' are placed on different sections of the net, likely indicating faces or assembly points. A key on the left explains that dotted lines represent folds and hatched lines represent glue tabs.
